abstract.p: Correction of April 14 article about hip resurfacing as alternative to replacement surgery, which takes three to four hours

block.p: An article in Business Day on Saturday about a medical procedure known as hip resurfacing, an alternative to a standard hip replacement, misstated the duration of hip replacement surgery. It generally requires an hour to 90 minutes -- not three to four hours, which would include the time spent in the recovery room. Because of an editing error, the article also misspelled the name of a hospital affiliated with the New York University Medical Center. It is Tisch Hospital, not Ticsch.
